sentences.en: Archaeologists have dated the fort to the reign of Emperor Antoninus Pius.
sentences.cn: 考古学家判定这个堡垒建于罗马皇帝安东尼·庇护统治时期。

sentences.en: Charlemagne was crowned Emperor on Christmas Day 800 AD.
sentences.cn: 查里曼于公元800年圣诞节加冕为皇帝.

sentences.en: Even the emperor has his poor relatives.
sentences.cn: 皇帝也有草鞋亲.

sentences.en: He had implicit faith in the noble intentions of the Emperor.
sentences.cn: 他对皇帝陛下高尚的动机深信不疑。

sentences.en: I am napoleon, I am emperor… burned it!
sentences.cn: 我就是拿破仑，我就是皇帝…烧掉它！

sentences.en: In keeping with tradition, the Emperor and Empress did not attend the ceremony.
sentences.cn: 按照传统，皇帝和皇后未参加该仪式。

sentences.en: Official handouts describe the Emperor as "particularly noted as a scholar".
sentences.cn: 官方印发的材料将皇帝描述为“尤以学识渊博而著称”。

sentences.en: the apotheosis of a Roman Emperor
sentences.cn: 册封罗马皇帝为神

sentences.en: The daughter of an emperor does not worry about finding a husband.
sentences.cn: 皇帝女儿不愁嫁。

sentences.en: The emperor issued an edict forbidding doing trade with foreigners.
sentences.cn: 皇帝颁布了一项不得和外国人做生意的敕令.

sentences.en: The Emperor must realize that he has us at his mercy.
sentences.cn: 皇帝必须意识到我们任由他处置。

sentences.en: The emperor promoted the general and lavished him with gifts.
sentences.cn: 皇帝擢升了将军并赏给他丰厚的礼物。

sentences.en: The emperor unified the country by the sword.
sentences.cn: 那位皇帝用武力统一了全国.

sentences.en: The emperor was clad in a rich robe encrusted with jewels.
sentences.cn: 皇帝身穿一件镶满宝石的华贵礼袍.

sentences.en: The emperor was deposed and his army disbanded.
sentences.cn: 皇帝被废黜,他的军队也被解散了.

sentences.en: The First Emperor of Qin unified China in 221 B.C.
sentences.cn: 秦始皇于公元前221年统一中国.

sentences.en: The old chancellor who had offended against the emperor was relegated to the distant boundaries of the country.
sentences.cn: 触犯了皇帝的老宰相被流放到遥远的边疆。

sentences.en: They  bowed before the emperor as he entered the court.
sentences.cn: 皇帝进入朝廷时他们都向他鞠躬致敬。

sentences.en: They caballed against the emperor's edict.
sentences.cn: 他们密谋反对皇帝的谕旨。

sentences.en: They prostrated themselves before the emperor.
sentences.cn: 他们拜倒在皇帝的面前.

trans.tran_en: the man who is the ruler of an empire
